page.title: 19COVENTRY CIVIC AIRPORT
page.content: This municipal airport, constructed in the 1930's covers some 140 hectares.It has a hard runway 5,300 feet long and is used mostly for commercial purposes Scheduled services operate to the Channel Islands leading to the Continent and so provides for the ever expanding tourist trade.Charter and passenger freight services link all parts of the world and air traffic increases substantially in the summer months.Maintenance spares facilities are available.Recently transporters and military aircraft have been using the airport including a Hercules of the Tunisian airforce and a Trident from Zaire. Several Flying clubs operate from the airfield with hourly tuition at Â£40 approx.Some nearby residents have private planes used for business purposes and pleasure.
